title: Château Tour des Gendres 2015 Tour des Gendres Red (Bergerac)
description: This is a rich dense wine, full of blackberry fruits. With its firm tannins behind ripe fruitiness, it has fresh acidity and layers of wood to give extra density. The wine is still maturing and should be ready from 2018.

title: Clos Troteligotte 2014 K-Libre 1040 Chenin Blanc (Côtes du Lot)
description: Produced in clay amphoras from organically grown grapes, this is an almost honeyed wine even though it's dry. It is richly textured and ripe, with floral and bitter spice tones. Enjoy from 2017.

title: Clovis Point 2013 Archeology Red (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Forward and fruity yet balanced and composed, this bold red blend is made from a kitchen's sink blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Syrah. Luscious black-cherry and plum flavors are ripe but keep a shade short of jammy and are highlighted by a bright vein of acidity. Bold, dense tannins on the finish should meld nicely by 2020.

title: Collin-Bourisset 2015  Beaujolais
description: This is an impressively rich wine for a simple Beaujolais. It has plenty of fruit, while it also has a good depth with ripe red-berry fruits and some well-integrated tannins.

title: Concha y Toro 2013 Marques de Casa Concha Syrah (Buin)
description: First up on the nose is a blast of oaky clove; next come whiffs of plum, mint and green herbs. This cool-vintage Syrah feels full but nervy. Briny, oaky flavors of black fruits mixed with clove and mint finish more woody and salty than fruity.

title: Conde de Subirats NV Cava Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny lemon-lime aromas come with a note of scrambled egg, which is not uncommon for Cava. Fresh and easy across the palate, this tastes of lettuce, dried apple, white pepper and salty brine. A dry, lightly salty finish maintains integrity.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2011 Test Pilot Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon offers fresh blackberries on cold slate and a light herbal character with dill, oregano and tarragon. A minty quality carries into the sip, where black plum, pepper dust and light tar show.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Point West White (Lisboa)
description: This is a ripe, smooth blend of Alvarinho and Chardonnay. The two complement each other well with yellow fruits touched by a more citrus edge and a rich character. It is fruity, full-bodied and ready to drink.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Scancio Reserva Touriga Nacional-Syrah Red (Lisboa)
description: Named after the Portuguese word for the sommelier's tastevin, the wine is rich with juicy red fruits. It has a firm structure that emphasizes the wine's youth showing that it should develop. Densely textured at the end, the wine will be ready to drink from 2017.

title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2013 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Le Regard de l'Ange  (Morgon)
description: A structured and concentrated wine that is packed with tannins. It does have some black fruit under this dry structure although the wine misses out on richness. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
designation: Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Le Regard de l'Ange

title: Casa S.M. de Tourais 2015 São Matias Branco White (Dão)
description: This fruity, perfumed wine has a light texture that cuts through the apricot and freshly squeezed citrus flavors. It is light and bright with attractive acidity on the finish. Drink now.

title: Casado Morales 2015 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Melon and stone-fruit aromas are clean and appealing. This feels citrusy and a touch drawing, with papaya, melon and nectarine flavors. A firm finish with a dry texture and a hint of pithy bitterness provides a good ending.

title: Cave Château de Chénas 2015 Coeur de Granit  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: The wine is almost too rich for a Beaujolais. However, it is ripe and fruity and immediately drinkable, full of juicy black fruits and soft tannins.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Collection Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Ripe peach and Damask rose make up the aromatic profile. The off-dry palate adds fleshier stone fruit as well as citrus freshness. This is a full bodied and generous wine with pure fruit framed with ample blossom.

title: Château d'Anglès 2015 Classique Mourvèdre-Syrah-Grenache Rosé (La Clape)
description: An extremely pale-pink color, this pretty rosé offers notes of strawberry hull and white raspberry that are framed by hints of pink flowers, garrigue herbs and melon rind. The light-weight palate is easy and bright, with great verve and lingering tones of white peach and cherry.

title: Astelia 2015 Pastel Rosé (Pays d'Oc)
description: Made from 42% Grenache, 23% Syrah, 18% Mourvèdre and 17% Cinsault, this is a lively and refreshing rosé. It leads with scents of white peach and cherry on the nose, with soft accents of raspberry and bramble in the background. The fruity tones carry through to the lightweight palate, lifted by bright, citrusy acidity and a clean finish.

title: Bieler Père et Fils 2015 Cuvée Sabine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This is a ripe, bone-dry wine that is full of rich fruit. It has fine acidity as well as wild strawberry and spice flavors along with a touch of pepper. These flavors are bound together by boundless acidity and a crisp texture. It is delicious to drink now.

title: Bodegas Hispano Suizas 2013 Tantum Ergo Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Gold in color and low on bubbles, this blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir smells mature and peachy. Sound but foamy on the palate, it delivers singular apple flavthat finish briskly. Drink immediately.

title: Duckhorn 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: With a pinkish hue, this wine has a healthy 21% addition of Sémillon. This contributes thick creaminess to its texture, built around well-defined flavors of vanilla, papaya and pear.

title: Dumas Station 2013 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of herb, green pepper, vanilla and lemon grass are followed by light but sweet cherry flavors. Vanilla notes provide accents.

title: Dumas Station 2013 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of cocoa, dark berries and spice are followed by full-bodied dark fruit flavors that seem to show some oxygen exposure. It's not shy but retains a sense of balance.

title: Domaine Gresser 2015 Kritt Riesling (Alsace)
description: A ripe, peachy nose leads to a sprightly palate with just a touch of fizz. The palate is broader and earthier than the nose suggests but remains dry and fresh.

title: Marcel Hugg 2015 Réserve Saint Jean Riesling (Alsace)
description: Ripeness of peach, citrus, apple and pear shimmers everywhere. The palate is clean, very fruit-driven and fresh, if a little upfront. Drink this refreshing and dry wine soon.

title: McManis 2015 Viognier (River Junction)
description: With an aroma like prosciutto and melon, a soft texture, and attractive floral and ripe peach flavors, this is a fun and affordable wine to drink at lunch or before dinner.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Ripanço Private Selection Red (Alentejano)
description: This wine is finely balanced, ripe with plenty of fruit and crisp with an edge of acidity. Its blackberry fruit and attractive tannic structure make this a wine that is ready to drink.

title: Januik 2013 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)
description: Pleasing aromas of cocoa, dried herb and red fruit lead to a full-bodied palate with a tight core of grippy tannins. Vanilla and spice notes run throughout.

title: Stéphane Aviron 2015  Beaujolais-Villages
description: This negociant wine is soft, ripe and smoothly textured. It has a fine balance between acidity and the rich red cherry fruit. With its edge of tannins, it has a good structure that gives it shape. Drinkable now.

title: Sketchbook 2014 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This dry wine has an appealing fruit character, light spiciness and a firm grip of tannin. It will pair well with roast birds or grilled sausages.

title: Pech Merle 2015 Ivy Rosé of Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: This is a stainless-steel fermented combo of 90% Syrah with 10% Zinfandel. It's light and easy on the nose but dark in color and brooding in weight, made in a full-bodied style.

title: Novelty Hill 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cocoa, toast and char aromas are out in front of red-fruit notes. The flavors are generous and full, with fruit and barrel flavors intertwining on the finish. The tannins bring some grip.
